title: Is sociology a good optional for UPSC Mains? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since I have sociology as my optional I am credible to give this answer . Yes sociology is a good optional for UPSC . It has very consise syllabus . Atleast paper 1 which has mostly thinkers part like Karl Marx , weber , Durkheim and etc . Syllabus is very less compared to other subjects . I have a engineering background and still I am pretty good in sociology. So no problem about your background . You can learn the paper 1 within 3 months with only 2–3 hrs of study . Their is Also no need of classes . For paper 2, syllabus is less but it is very vast. Anything from current affairs can come to exam . Like WHat are social significance of RTI OR MGNREGA . What are sociological contributions of Ambedkar or any social reformers . IT is very vast in these scenarios . It also helps you in GS 1 since we have Indians society as our topic so that’s part gets covered in sociology syllabus .even history parts such as land reforms , land tenure system , globalisation is also convered . You will also get benefit in essay since atleast one essay is going to be social one and therefore you will have advantage over there . Sociology paper 2 has lots of caste studies , data , example that also you can use in any essay . Most of our syllabus is non changing I paper 1 . So it’s mostly static part so you just have to ratta it. Though understanding will help your . It is quite easy to understand also . Books are available in market such as haralambos and ignou for paper 1 and Vikas ranjan And mohapatra notes and ignou for paper 2. If you want to join classes then Gaur classes in Delhi are goodbye for paper 1 and Mohapatra is good for paper 2 . But you should prefer Gaur sir . Overall It is a very good optional and very mark fetching also if you write it properly . Average marks are around 200–230. Question is very straight forward but in last 2 years they came quite dynamic so in future that may happen . SO choose wisely. All the best .

Choosing an Optional for Mains in Civil Services Examination (CSE) may be a critical task. With a share of 500 marks out of the entire, the proper choice of optional will enable you to realize the success you desire. The Common Parameters one looks into while Choosing an Optional Subject are: Whether the topic has High Scoring PotentialHow Lengthy is that the SyllabusHow hard it's to reviewWhether it's to your liking or notThe subject Sociology fulfills a number of the above parameters. But, there are more reasons why you ought to select this subject as your optional. Here are the explanations why Sociology is one of the simplest optional subjects the toppers choose. here you'll find the Sociology optional syllabus. A High Scoring and Safe Optional Sociology may be a high scoring optional and at an equivalent time a secure optional. Safe within the sense that you simply will get marks albeit you write something relevant to the subject asked. A score of 180-200 is usually possible with this optional. Also, a high score of 350+ is feasible. Popular Choice The subject is popular among the IAS aspirants. Among the highest ten rankers, you'll find a minimum of one candidate with the optional sociology. it's also performing consistently over the years. Other popular subjects like Public Administration and Geography are seeing high and low-performance years. they're becoming unreliable. Easy Syllabus Sociology is actually about society. The way people play their roles, the results of their actions on the general society, the varied institutions of the society, the impact of state decisions on various communities, etc are addressed within the subject. Studying and understanding such issues is straightforward as they happen in our day-to-day lives. Even an individual without prior knowledge of the subject can study it. Also, the topic is extremely interesting to review. Limited Syllabus Some of the optionals listed within the CSE syllabus have a lengthy syllabus. they're exhaustive. Unlike them, Sociology features a limited syllabus which you'll cover in 3-4 months' time. this is often a plus considering the quantity of your time required for studying general studies papers. Helps in Essay Paper The essay paper is that the most dynamic paper among the mains papers. Cracking this paper needs an additional understanding of varied aspects of the planet and India. Sociology helps here. Be it, women, related issues, or the impact of AI on society, sociology will enable you to supply diverse viewpoints. Aids generally Studies Papers In each paper of general studies, some elements of sociology are present. In GS paper I, the optional will help in answering questions associated with Indian society, women issues, and topics like social empowerment, communalism, socialism, etc. Similarly, in GS paper II, development and management of social sectors, welfare schemes for vulnerable sections, NGOs, SHGs, etc have some sociological connotation. In GS paper III, economic and ecological impacts on various sections of the society, spread of extremism, etc are often answered. and lots of more concepts of Ethics paper are often answered with sociological knowledge. Helps within the Interview Awareness of varied flaws of the society and therefore the impact of governance on communities will are available handy during the interview. it'll cause you to be grounded and be realistic within the interview round. Sociology will assist you in having that knowledge. Having read sociology, you'll have a transparent picture on your mind that there are no one-size-fits-all solutions. you'll be realistic in your approach and deliver better service.
